summary: This is an email chain from Chris Dilorio alleging connections between Apollo Global Management, Jeffrey Epstein, and Jared Kushner, accusing the SEC of corruption and intentional negligence regarding penny stock fraud and money laundering. The author claims to be a whistleblower who received threatening calls after filing complaints.

connections.description: Connected through SEC filings in Environmental Solutions Worldwide, with Epstein's Financial Trust Company Inc. filing appearing in documents related to Black/Apollo.
Harris met with Kushner at the White House and was considered for a White House job; Apollo provided a loan to Kushner Companies.
Apollo gave Kushner Companies a $180 million loan, after which the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo.
Dilorio filed complaints against the SEC, accusing it of corruption and intentional negligence regarding penny stock fraud.

keyFacts: Chris Dilorio alleges the SEC intentionally enables penny stock fraud and money laundering, specifically citing Environmental Solutions Worldwide as an example.
Dilorio claims a direct connection between Apollo Global Management (Leon Black, Joshua Harris) and Jeffrey Epstein through SEC filings related to Environmental Solutions Worldwide.
The email chain asserts the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo shortly after Apollo provided a $180 million loan to Jared Kushner's family business.
Dilorio states he received threatening anonymous phone calls after filing complaints against the SEC, viewing it as witness intimidation.

The document links several high-profile legal figures (Stephanie Avakian, Howard Heiss, Jamie Gorelick, Robert Mueller) to the firms (O'Melveny & Myers, WilmerHale) perceived as connected to Apollo/Kushner matters.
